info.title: Wherefour API
info.description: API documentation for the Wherefour ERP/traceability platform. More information at: [wherefour.com](https://wherefour.com).

get.description: Returns inventory items that match the given name or SKU. Multiple matches may be returned.

requestBody.description: Search can be performed based on EITHER the inventory item name, OR a single SKU or an array of SKUs. The inventory item name will take precedence over the SKU parameter. Multiple matches may be returned.

get.description: Lists the quotes for a the customer.

post.description: Creates a new quote for the customer.

/customers/{customer_id}/orders/auto_shi.description: Performs a "pick and ship" for the specified order. Wherefour will auto-select available lot coded inventory, based on each inventory items pull strategy, to fulfill the order. If not enough inventory is available, a partial shipment will be created. Results of the shipment, with the selected stock lots, will be returned.

schema.description: Name of the Wherefour delivery method to use for the shipment. Name lookup will use the closest found match for the name provided or "null" for no match.

location_name.description: Name of the Wherefour location to pull stock from. If not provided, auto ship will pull available stock lots from any location. Name lookup will use the closest found match for the name provided or "null" for no match.

tracking_number.description: Tracking number to record for the shipment.

post.description:
Performs a "pick and ship" for the specified order. Wherefour will auto-select available lot coded inventory, based on each inventory item's pull strategy, to fulfill the order. If the location is specified, only inventory at that location will be considered. If not enough inventory is available, a partial shipment will be created. Results of the shipment, with the selected stock lots, will be returned.

The optional ship_date param can be used to specify the timestamp of the shipment. Date/time should be in the format "2021-02-02 12:00 AM" and in the same time zone as the user's Wherefour settings.

post.summary: Get inventory adjustment activity for a date range
post.description: Lists inventory adjustment activity for a date range. The IDs of records returned are for the adjustment record.

parameters.name: start_date_time
parameters.description: Start date/time for the oldest adjustment record to return, based on the adjustment's effective_at timestamp

parameters.name: end_date_time
parameters.description: End date/time for the newest adjustment record to return, based on the adjustment's effective_at timestamp

parameters.name: activity_types
parameters.description: Restrict records to the provided adjustment activity types

parameters.name: category_ids
parameters.description: Restrict records to inventory and stock lot that belong to the provided category IDs

parameters.name: customer_ids
parameters.description: Restrict records to activity associated with specific customer IDs

parameters.name: inventory_ids
parameters.description: Restrict records to the provided inventory IDs

parameters.name: location_ids
parameters.description: Restrict records to the provided location IDs

parameters.name: statuses
parameters.description: Restrict records to stock lots with the provided statuses

parameters.name: user_ids
parameters.description: Restrict records to adjustments made by the provided used IDs

parameters.name: vendor_ids
parameters.description: Restrict records to activity associated with specific vendor IDs

parameters.name: lot_code
parameters.description: Restrict records to adjustments made only to stock lots with the provided lot code

parameters.name: barcode
parameters.description: Restrict records to adjustments made only to stock lots with the provided barcode

parameters.name: serial_number
parameters.description: Restrict records to adjustments made only to stock lots with the provided serial number
